channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.

item.title: All-metallic magnetic Purcell enhancement in a thermally stable room-temperature maser
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-66016-z

Dielectric structures that enhance magnetic emission are key for quantum devices but often suffer from thermal instability. Here, the authors realize a dielectric-free, compact metallic resonator with strong Purcell enhancement, enabling stable room-temperature maser action.
item.dc:title: All-metallic magnetic Purcell enhancement in a thermally stable room-temperature maser
item.dc:creator: Rongrong Xiang
Philippe Bugnon
Maliheh Khatibi Moghaddam
Romain Fleury

item.title: Efficient perovskite/Cu(In,Ga)Se<sub>2</sub> tandem solar cells with a composite intermediate recombination layer
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 10 December 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-67350-y

Challenges remain in optimizing efficiency and stability of monolithic perovskite/Cu(In,Ga)Se2 (CIGS) tandem solar cells. Here, authors develop a composite-structured intermediate recombination layer and achieve maximum efficiency of 28.04% and 30.71% for 0.51 cm2 and 0.15 cm2 cells, respectively.
item.dc:title: Efficient perovskite/Cu(In,Ga)Se<sub>2</sub> tandem solar cells with a composite intermediate recombination layer
item.dc:creator: Wang Li
